actions.human_description: First, you need to head over to the login page on GitHub.
actions.gpt_description: Navigate to the GitHub login page.

actions.human_description: Now, just type in your username and password to get started.
actions.gpt_description: Enter username and password to log in.

actions.human_description: Go ahead and click the login button to access your account.
actions.gpt_description: Click the login button to access the account.

actions.human_description: Once you're logged in, find your way to the 'New Repository' page.
actions.gpt_description: Navigate to the page for creating a new repository.

actions.human_description: Here, you'll want to fill in the name and description for your new repository.
actions.gpt_description: Enter the name and description for the new repository.

actions.human_description: Decide if you want your repository to be public or private.
actions.gpt_description: Choose whether the repository is public or private.

actions.human_description: You can choose to start with a README file if you like.
actions.gpt_description: Select whether to initialize the repository with a README file.

actions.human_description: Finally, click the 'Create repository' button to finish up.
actions.gpt_description: Click the button to create the new repository.
